intro: Palicourea pakaraimensis, commonly known as the Pakaraima palicourea, is a shrub native to the Guyana Shield region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by berries that range in color from red to black. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
